questions.question: What is dynamic memory allocation in C++?
Which operator is used to allocate memory dynamically?
What operator is used to deallocate memory that was allocated using 'new'?
What is a memory leak?
options: When memory is not properly freed
When memory is allocated but not used
When too much memory is allocated
questions.correctAnswer: When memory is not properly freed

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'new[]' operator?
options: To allocate memory for a single variable
To allocate memory for an array
questions.correctAnswer: To allocate memory for an array

questions.question: Which function is used to allocate memory dynamically in C?
What should you always do after using 'new'?
options: Use delete to free the memory
questions.correctAnswer: Use delete to free the memory

questions.question: What is the difference between 'new' and 'malloc'?
options: new initializes the memory; malloc does not
new can throw exceptions; malloc cannot

questions.question: What is the purpose of a smart pointer?
options: To provide more control over memory allocation
